captions.text: Have you started shaving yet?
Yes, a few hairs began to grow so I have finally started shaving.
Ah yes, I can see that your skin is very smooth.
When did I make my debut with Juve?
How many goals did I score last season?
If I remember rightly, you scored one or two goals?
Come on!
Did you become a 'keeper because you don't like running?
Yes! I realised very early in my life that people with brains stand still and use their heads while the others run around!
If you weren't a footballer, what would have been your dream job?
A pilot, what would you have been?
I'd have been a school teacher.
Who was your childhood hero?
Batman. Who is your hero nowadays?
Nowadays, it would have to be Obama.
What's your favourite colour?
Black, yours?
Yellow.
Would you prefer to win 1-0 or 4-3?
4-3, and you?
1-0 all day long. My dream since I was a child has been to win the title with 38 1-0 victories.
Do you prefer shots to the left or the right side of the goal?
Do you think I'd still be playing at the top level at 37 years of age if I had any weaknesses?
Let's wait and see.
Where do you put your penalties?
I'm not going to tell you that!
You can tell me, a top player shouldn't be scared!
What's the best day of the week?
Saturday, because Sunday is match day and on Saturday I start feeling the adrenaline.
What's your favourite film?
Wolf of Wall Street. Who's your favourite actor?
I have two favourite actors, one is De Niro and the other is Al Pacino.
If they made a film about your life, who would play you?
Denzel Washington.
What's your prediction for the match?
A Borussia Dortmund win, what do you think?
A narrow victory for us.
Who is the best keeper of all time?
Well, we should speak about the second best because we all know who the best is…
You, of course.
Thank you!
Who is the best Dortmund player?
Immobile. No, no I'm joking! It's you of course, what kind of a question is that!

comments.text:
+shumlina That's not the point. Calling yourself a football fan, while you 
switch between teams that happen to be at the top of the league they are 
in, then differentiating further because you cant decide which footballer 
you have the hots for, that is what is irritating. Yeah, sure there are 
lots of good looking footballers, but to only like football because of that 
is plain stupid.
 
As Sally mentioned, she got into BVB through Erik Durm, a player I happen 
to like. However I have stuck with supporting Man United because I SUPPORT 
them, I don't blabber on about random stuff like their family members or 
partners, I support the team and the players. But going through a series of 
players I have liked doesn't change that. I might find interest in some but 
that doesn't make me support their team. The fact that sally said it was in 
the family,(supporting Bayern), makes it even worse.

If she really supported Bayern, she wouldnt have gone for BVB straight away.
Moral of this comment: She is a glory hunter.


Sorry for the long comment
comments.author: Mrs G18

comments.text:
+Mrs G18
I know you wrote this to Sally, but let me interject as a woman who loves 
soccer and also likes looking at the gorgeous players. You're not in any 
minority. Women and girls love the game all over the world. And, the 
Women's World Cup is just around the corner too, taking place in my 
country, and I'll be going to a few games. What you claim, is the same type 
of stuff guys say about us, like: 'I bet you only watch for the hot 
players. Do you even know what offside means? Can you even name the entire 
XIs and benches of the 1998 France final?' You need to examine your 
internalized misogyny.

Also, who cares if some of us like hot players? Nobody is that ridiculous 
to ONLY like the game for the players and their nice thighs. Most of the 
time, these hotties are just tiny specs on a green field, right? lol
